history.proof: induction s. - simpl. auto. - simpl. rewrite IHs. auto.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
S: Type
T: Type
s: seq (S * T)

Goal:
unzip1 s = [seq fst i | i <- s]

Premises:
unzip1 = fun S T : Type => map fst : forall S T : Type, seq (S * T) -> seq S Arguments S, T are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope seq_scope]
fst = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (x, _) := p in x : forall A B : Type, A * B -> A Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
Notation seq := list
map_reshape : forall (T S : Type) (f : T -> S) (sh : seq nat) (s : seq T), [seq [seq f i | i <- i] | i <- reshape sh s] = reshape sh [seq f i | i <- s]
behead_map : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), behead [seq f i | i <- s] = [seq f i | i <- behead s]
map_rev : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- rev s] = rev [seq f i | i <- s]
pmapS_filter : forall (aT rT : Type) (f : aT -> option rT) (s : seq aT), [seq Some i | i <- pmap f s] = [seq f i | i <- s & f i]
filter_map : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (a : pred T2) (s : seq T1), [seq x <- [seq f i | i <- s] | a x] = [seq f i | i <- s & pred_of_simpl (preim f a) i]
map_rcons : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1) (x : T1), [seq f i | i <- rcons s x] = rcons [seq f i | i <- s] (f x)
map_mask : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (m : bitseq) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- mask m s] = mask m [seq f i | i <- s]
map_rotr : forall (n0 : nat) (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- rotr n0 s] = rotr n0 [seq f i | i <- s]
map_drop : forall (n0 : nat) (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- drop n0 s] = drop n0 [seq f i | i <- s]
map_take : forall (n0 : nat) (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- take n0 s] = take n0 [seq f i | i <- s]
map_rot : forall (n0 : nat) (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- rot n0 s] = rot n0 [seq f i | i <- s]
map_cons : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (x : T1) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- x :: s] = f x :: [seq f i | i <- s]
belast_map : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1) (x : T1), seq.belast (f x) [seq f i | i <- s] = [seq f i | i <- seq.belast x s]
map_comp : forall (T1 T2 T3 : Type) (f1 : T2 -> T3) (f2 : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq ssrfun.comp f1 f2 i | i <- s] = [seq f1 i | i <- [seq f2 i | i <- s]]
eq_in_map : forall (T1 : eqtype.Equality.type) (T2 : Type) (f1 f2 : eqtype.Equality.sort T1 -> T2) (s : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T1)), {in s, ssrfun.eqfun f1 f2} < -> [seq f1 i | i <- s] = [seq f2 i | i <- s]
size_map : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), size [seq f i | i <- s] = size s
perm_map : forall (T1 T2 : eqtype.Equality.type) (f : eqtype.Equality.sort T1 -> eqtype.Equality.sort T2) (s t : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T1)), perm_eq s t -> perm_eq [seq f i | i <- s] [seq f i | i <- t]
pmap_filter : forall (aT rT : Type) (f : aT -> option rT) (g : rT -> aT), ssrfun.ocancel f g -> forall s : seq aT, [seq g i | i <- pmap f s] = [seq x <- s | f x]
map_flatten : forall (S T : Type) (f : T -> S) (ss : seq (seq T)), [seq f i | i <- flatten ss] = [seq f y | x <- ss, y <- x]
map_of_seq : forall (T1 : eqtype.Equality.type) (T2 : Type) (s : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T1)) (fs : seq T2), T2 -> {f : eqtype.Equality.sort T1 -> T2 | uniq s -> size fs = size s -> [seq f i | i <- s] = fs}
map_inj_in_uniq : forall (T1 T2 : eqtype.Equality.type) (f : eqtype.Equality.sort T1 -> eqtype.Equality.sort T2) (s : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T1)), {in s &, ssrfun.injective f} -> uniq [seq f i | i <- s] = uniq s
map_cat : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s1 s2 : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- s1 ++ s2] = [seq f i | i <- s1] ++ [seq f i | i <- s2]
perm_iotaP : forall x0 : eqtype.Equality.sort ?T, let It := iota 0 (size ?t) in reflect (exists2 Is : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort ssrnat.nat_eqType), perm_eq Is It & ?s = [seq nth x0 ?t i | i <- Is]) (perm_eq ?s ?t) where ?T : [S : Type T : Type s : seq (S * T) |- eqtype.Equality.type] ?s : [S : Type T : Type s : seq (S * T) |- seq (eqtype.Equality.sort ?T)] ?t : [S : Type T : Type s : seq (S * T) |- seq (eqtype.Equality.sort ?T)]
map_id_in : forall (T : eqtype.Equality.type) (f : eqtype.Equality.sort T -> eqtype.Equality.sort T) (s : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T)), {in s, ssrfun.eqfun f (fun x : eqtype.Equality.sort T => x)} -> [seq f i | i <- s] = s
map_pairmap : forall (f : ?T0 -> ?T1) (g : ?T -> ?T -> ?T0) (s0 : seq ?T) (x0 : ?T), [seq f i | i <- pairmap g x0 s0] = pairmap (fun x y : ?T => f (g x y)) x0 s0 where ?T : [S : Type T : Type s : seq (S * T) |- Type] ?T0 : [S : Type T : Type s : seq (S * T) |- Type] ?T1 : [S : Type T : Type s : seq (S * T) |- Type]

```coq
induction s.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite IHs. auto.
Qed.
```
